title: Gary Neville hails Mike Dean as the VAR king after Ryan Bertrand red card
text:
Andre Marriner sent off Ryan Bertrand thanks to VAR Mike Dean (Picture: Getty Images)

Mike Dean has earned praise for his VAR work after Southampton’s Ryan Bertrand was sent off against Leicester in the Premier League on Friday night.

The England international was shown a red card just 12 minutes into the contest at St Mary’s for a studs-up lunge on Ayoze Perez.

Referee Andre Marriner did not notice the incident, but Mike Dean was all over the matter in reviewing it via replays.

VAR has been criticised for the original decisions not being overruled, despite clear fouls being committed, but Sky Sports pundit Gary Neville believes Dean is the man for the job given his experience and confidence.

‘No one can look at this and say that it’s not a red card,’ said Neville. ‘I think the doubt is that they’ve been so reluctant to overrule things, VAR.

‘Mike Dean, I always thought that he’d be the one that would be confident enough to do it. Martin Tyler mentioned last week about a younger referee not over-ruling another one.

"It's a shocker…" 🔵 1-0 to Leicester

‘It’s a bad touch, and an instinctive lunge, it’s not got that excessive force where he’s jumping in at it, but I don’t think that any football fan could look at it [and disagree with the red card], because he holds his leg in there as well and you can see why it’s been overturned.

‘From that moment on for Southampton it was really, really bad.’

Bertrand looked bemused with the decision as he was given his marching orders, but the tackle was shown on the big screen in Southampton and the fans quickly understood why the full-back was sent off.

Jamie Carragher backed the decision and the choice to show it to supporters: ‘It was the right decision,’ said the former Liverpool man. ‘He can certainly have no complaints. The ball just runs away from him, he dives at it and it’s a shocking tackle.

‘Absolutely brilliant showing the crowd, there’s no complaints here from the Southampton fans, no booing.’

Southampton fans were booing later in the game as they found themselves 5-0 behind to the Foxes at half-time.
